conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force on the object as it is transported from point M to point N.
Calculate frictional force f = mu * m * g = 9 N.
Determine acceleration a = f / m = 3 m/s^2.
Calculate time to reach conveyor speed t = v / a = 2 s.
Calculate distance traveled while accelerating d = 1/2 * a * t^2 = 6 m.
Calculate remaining distance at constant speed d_remaining = L1 - d = 4 m.
Calculate work done by friction W = f * d = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
